description:
Yuna's not your typical 15-year-old. First, she's crazy rich from playing the stock market. Second, she's a recluse obsessed with a VRMMO game, and she's really good at that too. Her life is pretty much perfect—until she wakes up one day inside the game she loves and back at level one. She has to start over, but this time, she has a powerful bear suit that's guaranteed to take her places!

(Source: Funimation)

Note: The first episode was streamed on Abema TV on September 19, 2020. The regular TV broadcast started on October 7, 2020.
synonyms: The Bears Bear a Bare Kuma

tags.name: Primarily Child Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters below a high school age.

tags.name: Isekai
tags.description: Features characters being transported into an alternate world setting and having to adapt to their new surroundings.

tags.name: Cute Girls Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around female characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Medieval
tags.description: Partially or completely set in the Middle Ages or a Middle Ages-inspired setting. Commonly features elements such as European castles and knights.

tags.description: Centers around cooking or food appraisal.

tags.name: Video Games
tags.description: Centers around characters playing video games.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: Virtual World
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the world inside a video game.

tags.name: Animals
tags.description: Prominently features animal characters in a leading role.

tags.name: Augmented Reality
tags.description: Prominently features events with augmented reality as the main setting.

tags.name: Iyashikei
tags.description: Primary aim is to heal the audience through serene depictions of characters' daily lives.

node.description:
__Hobbies:__ Games, eating, tennis, swimming

[Website](https://columbia.jp/wakiazumi) | [Talent Page](https://haikyo.co.jp/profile/profile.php?ActorID=12722) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/azumi_waki) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/ajujustaff) | [Instagram (Personal)](https://www.instagram.com/azumi_waki)

On August 10, 2023, she announced on Twitter her marriage to her longtime partner met through a shared hobby of gaming.

**Non-Anime Roles:**
~!
• Charlotte (Genshin Impact)
 • Mem (Honkai: Star rail)!~

He is an art director and supervisor, who was a long time member of Bihou until 2007 when he went to head the background art department in Totonyan. He belongs to the anime production group Neko-Nanban-Tei together with director Watanabe Takashi and his wife Miyata Naomi.

__[Profile (F.M.F Corporation)](http://www.fmf-music.com/creators2.html#id69)__ | __[Blog (JP)](http://sk55.seesaa.net/)__

__Birthplace:__ Takayama City, Gifu Prefecture, Japan
__Favorite Artists:__ Brian Eno, Coldcut, Miles Davis

__Shigeo Komori__ is a Japanese keyboardist, music producer, composer and arranger.

Jad is an American voice actress and ADR director who works for Funimation and Sentai Filmworks. Her name is an acronym of her parents' names, Jimmy and David, and is pronounced as Jade. Her singing led to her first voice role in Sasami: Magical Girls Club as Eimi Mori, and her first major voice role was Masako Hara in Ghost Hunt. She graduated summa cum laude from Texas Wesleyan University with a Bachelor of Arts in Music in 2005.

(Source: Wikipedia)
